roleset.name: turn over, remove soil, excavation
roleset.note: DIG-V NOTES: Based on WSJ. Member of VNcls poke-19, create-26.4-1, hunt-35.1. (from dig.01-v)
DIG-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on nouns-00080, dig-v.01. Corresponds to VNcls hunt-35.1. (from dig.02-n)
DIGGING-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT, dig-n.02. Corresponds to VNcls hunt-35.1. (from digging.01-n)

example.name: dig for
example.text: `` If you can use data to reconstruct what happened in the past , you have much more confidence in predictions for the future, ''said Lonnie Thompson , a research scientist at Ohio State who-3 [*T*-3] dug for [*RNR*-1]and analyzed[*RNR*-1} [the ice samples] -1 .

example.name: with adverbials
example.text: They-1 just keep [*-1] digging me in deeper until I reach the point where I give up and go away . ''
example.arg: until I reach the point where I give up and go away

example.name: the hole
example.text: Minneapolis cop dug a hole for himself in shovel dustup

example.name: args 0 and 3
example.text: After Arillotta became a cooperating witness investigators began their dig for Westerman.

example.name: archaeology
example.text: Archaeologists in Prince Edward Island are wrapping up their dig of a 300 year old Acadian village near the Tyne Valley.
example.arg: of a 300 year old Acadian village near the Tyne Valley

example.name: Light Verb
example.text: Anyway , I did a little more digging , and I found a statement from the project manager .

roleset.name: to like
roleset.note: DIG-V NOTES: Based on Bolt data. No comparison. No VN or FN classes. Framed by Katie. (from dig.04-v)

example.name: something they don't like
example.text: I'm not really digging the trailer.

roleset.name: make an aggressive remark about
roleset.note: DIG-N NOTES: Based on nouns-00080. Slight comparison to 'jab-v'. No VN or FN classes. Framed by Katie. (from dig.01-n)

example.name: Arg 0 and 2
example.text: Her constant digs at me are tiring.

example.name: Arg 0 and 2
example.text: Sometimes he would have a dig at his students

roleset.name: to excavate, turn up
roleset.note: DIG_UP-V NOTES: See VNcls hunt-35.1. (from dig.02-v)

example.name: transitive
example.text: Police suspect that the criminals , who-1 [*T*-1] dig up the plants in the dead of night , are selling them to nurseries or landscapers .

roleset.name: to remove
roleset.note: DIG_OUT-V NOTES: See VNcls hunt-35.1. (from dig.03-v)

example.name: transitive
example.text: Days later , the thieves returned and dug out more .
